text:
Double top and triple top patterns are similar to the head-and-shoulders pattern in
that they indicate weakening in the buying pressure that has been driving an uptrend.
In both cases, the price reaches a resistance level at which selling pressure appears
repeatedly, preventing any further increase in the price. As with the head-and-shoulders,
the size of a double or triple top pattern can be used to project a price target for the next
downtrend.
